text: BACK TO POLICIES or until the site comes forward for development to meet its full potential or allocated use(s). Proposals for meanwhile uses should include a ‘move-on’ plan showing how the temporary use will move to a new suitable premise when a permanent occupier takes on the space or it is redeveloped. Where the application can demonstrate that the use is genuinely temporary in nature – meaning that there will be no loss of employment when the use ceases – a ‘move on’ plan may not be necessary.
